properties.headline: Flood Warning issued February 14 at 9:17AM EST until February 17 at 4:20PM EST by NWS Columbia SC
properties.description:
...The National Weather Service in Columbia has issued a flood
warning for the following rivers in South Carolina...

Pee Dee River At Cheraw affecting Chesterfield and Marlboro
Counties

.Rainfall amounts from one half inch up to one inch combined with
water moving down Yadkin-Pee Dee River Basin will produce a rise
into minor flooding at Cheraw over the next 24 to 36 hours.

The National Weather Service in Columbia has issued a

* Flood Warning for
The Pee Dee River At Cheraw
* from this evening to Monday afternoon...Or until the warning is
cancelled.
* At  830 AM Friday the stage was 27.0 feet.
* Flood stage is 30.0 feet.
* Minor flooding is forecast.
* forecast...The river will rise above flood stage this evening
and crest around 32.0 feet tomorrow evening. The river will fall
below flood stage Sunday February 16.
* At 33.0 feet...Southeast of Wallace, water spreads onto Old River
Road between Community Road and Highway 912.
* At 30.0 feet...The higher bank begins to flood. Large areas of
farmland and river bottomland near Cheraw will be flooded. Portions
of Riverside Park become flooded.
* At 20.0 feet...River bottomland downstream from cheraw will begin to
flood.
properties.instruction:
Safety message...never drive vehicles through flooded areas. The
water may be too deep to allow safe passage. Never allow children to
play in or near flood waters. Stay tuned to noaa weather radio...
local media or the internet for further statements and updated
forecasts.
